title: Buildings and Grounds
description: Requirements for building and grounds maintenance including structural integrity, lighting, ventilation, drains, walls and ceilings, doors and windows, and prevention of facility-related contamination

requirements.text: Are all lights in the facility that could potentially contaminate raw materials, work in progress, ingredients (including ice), finished goods, equipment or packaging shielded, coated or otherwise shatter resistant to protect product from contamination in the event of breakage?
mandatoryStatements: All lights over exposed products must be shielded, coated, or shatter-resistant
Light protection must prevent glass contamination if breakage occurs
Regular inspections must verify protective measures are intact
Broken or missing protection must be replaced immediately
Light protection program must be documented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly light fixture protection inspection, annual comprehensive facility light audit
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly visual verification of light protection, immediate replacement of damaged shields or sleeves

requirements.text: Has the operation eliminated or adequately controlled any potential metal, glass or brittle plastic contamination issues?
mandatoryStatements: Metal, glass, and brittle plastic sources must be eliminated or controlled
Glass and brittle plastic prohibited in production areas where possible
Foreign material control program must address physical hazards
Regular audits must identify and eliminate potential sources
Incident investigation required for any physical contamination
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual facility assessment for glass, metal, and brittle plastic hazards, quarterly control verification
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly inspection for unauthorized glass or brittle plastic, immediate removal if found

requirements.text: Has the facility eliminated or adequately controlled the use of wooden items or surfaces?
mandatoryStatements: Wood items and surfaces should be eliminated or adequately controlled
Wood pallets and equipment must be in good condition without splinters
Porous wood surfaces difficult to sanitize should be replaced with non-porous alternatives
Regular inspection must verify wood item condition
Damaged wood items must be removed from service
requirements.verificationExpectations: Semi-annual wood item inspection and condition assessment, annual evaluation of wood elimination opportunities
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly inspection of wood pallets and items, immediate removal of damaged wood

requirements.text: Is there adequate lighting in the production and storage areas?
mandatoryStatements: Production and storage areas must have adequate lighting for tasks performed
Lighting intensity must meet or exceed regulatory requirements
Lighting must enable proper inspection and cleaning
Non-functional lights must be replaced promptly
Lighting adequacy must be assessed and documented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual lighting intensity measurements and adequacy assessment, quarterly verification of light functionality
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily identification of non-functional lights, immediate replacement or repair

requirements.text: Is ventilation adequate to control dust, condensation, odors and vapors?
mandatoryStatements: Ventilation must be adequate to control dust, condensation, odors, and vapors
Air exchange rates must be appropriate for operations
Airflow direction must be from clean to less-clean areas
Condensation must be controlled and directed away from products
Regular maintenance and filter replacement required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Semi-annual airflow pattern assessment and ventilation effectiveness evaluation, quarterly filter maintenance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily observation of condensation and ventilation effectiveness, immediate response to inadequate ventilation

requirements.text: Are floor surfaces in good condition, with no standing water, no debris trapping cracks and are they easy to clean?
mandatoryStatements: Floor surfaces must be maintained in good condition
Standing water must be prevented through proper drainage and floor slope
Cracks and crevices that trap debris must be repaired
Floors must be constructed of materials that facilitate cleaning
Regular floor maintenance and repair program required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly floor condition inspection identifying cracks, drainage issues, and repair needs
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily observation for standing water, immediate cleanup and drainage correction

requirements.text: Are there floor drains and waste trap systems located where they are needed for drainage?
mandatoryStatements: Floor drains must be located where needed for effective drainage
Drain coverage must be adequate for facility operations
Drains must be properly sized for drainage volumes
Waste trap systems must be installed and functional
Additional drains should be installed if inadequate drainage observed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual drainage system adequacy assessment, quarterly drain function verification
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily observation of drainage effectiveness, immediate drain installation or repair if standing water occurs

requirements.text: Are exterior doors kept closed and are closed doors and windows to the outside pest-proof?
mandatoryStatements: Exterior doors must be kept closed when not in active use
Doors and windows must be pest-proof with proper seals and screens
Self-closing mechanisms should be installed where appropriate
Door and window integrity must be maintained
Regular inspection and maintenance of seals and screens required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly door and window seal inspection, annual pest exclusion effectiveness assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that doors remain closed, immediate repair of damaged seals or screens

requirements.text: Are dock load levelers and buffers/shelters maintained in good condition, pest proof and debris free?
mandatoryStatements: Dock load levelers and shelters must be maintained in good condition
Dock areas must be pest-proof with properly functioning seals
Debris must be removed regularly from dock areas
Dock door seals must be inspected and repaired as needed
Regular dock area cleaning and maintenance required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly dock area condition inspection including load levelers and seals, quarterly maintenance verification
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly dock area cleanliness check, immediate repair of damaged seals or equipment

requirements.text: Are exterior walls free of holes to exclude pests, and are pipes, vents, and air ducts designed and protected in order to prevent pest entry (e.g., by using fine mesh)?
mandatoryStatements: Exterior walls must be free of holes and gaps that allow pest entry
Pipes, vents, and air duct penetrations must be properly sealed
Fine mesh screens must be installed on vents and openings
Regular inspection must identify pest entry points
Structural gaps must be filled and sealed promptly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Semi-annual exterior wall and penetration inspection for pest entry points, annual comprehensive pest exclusion assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly visual inspection of exterior walls and penetrations, immediate sealing of identified gaps

requirements.text: Are interior walls and ceilings free of cracks and crevices to prevent pest harborage and allow proper sanitation?
mandatoryStatements: Interior walls and ceilings must be maintained free of cracks and crevices
Surfaces must allow effective cleaning and sanitation
Regular inspection must identify structural deterioration
Cracks and crevices must be repaired to prevent pest harborage
Smooth, cleanable surfaces preferred for food production areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly interior surface inspection for cracks and damage, annual comprehensive structural assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly visual inspection during cleaning operations, immediate repair of identified cracks

requirements.text: Is an 18" (46 cm) internal wall perimeter being maintained within the facility, with adequate access to these wall perimeters, thereby allowing inspection and cleaning?
mandatoryStatements: Minimum 18-inch (46 cm) clearance must be maintained along interior wall perimeters
Perimeter access must allow inspection and cleaning
Equipment and materials must not block perimeter access
Regular inspection must verify perimeter clearance is maintained
Adequate space must exist for pest control device placement along perimeters
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly perimeter clearance inspection, annual facility layout assessment for access adequacy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly verification that perimeter clearance is maintained, immediate removal of obstructions

requirements.text: Is the exterior area immediately outside the facility, including roads, yards and parking areas, free of litter, weeds and standing water?
mandatoryStatements: Exterior areas must be maintained free of litter, excessive vegetation, and standing water
Regular grounds maintenance must prevent pest harborage conditions
Vegetation must be controlled near building perimeter
Standing water must be eliminated through drainage or filling
Regular grounds inspection and cleanup required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly exterior grounds inspection for litter, vegetation, and standing water, quarterly comprehensive grounds maintenance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly visual inspection of exterior areas, immediate cleanup and maintenance as needed

requirements.text: Are control measures being implemented for the outside storage of equipment, pallets, tires, etc. (i.e., out of the mud, pipe ends capped, stacked to prevent pest harborage, away from the building perimeter)?
mandatoryStatements: Outdoor stored items must be elevated off ground or on paved surfaces
Items must be stacked to prevent pest harborage
Pipe ends must be capped to prevent pest entry
Storage must be located away from building perimeter (minimum 20 feet preferred)
Regular inspection must verify proper storage practices
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly outdoor storage inspection for pest harborage conditions, quarterly storage organization assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly verification of proper storage practices, immediate correction of pest harborage conditions

requirements.text: Are pallets inspected to separate and replace dirty or broken pallets, and broken or dirty pallets are not in use?
mandatoryStatements: Pallets must be inspected before use
Dirty or broken pallets must be separated and not used
Damaged pallets must be repaired or discarded
Clean, intact pallets required for product contact
Regular pallet quality inspection program required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly pallet inventory condition inspection, quarterly pallet quality assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily receiving inspection of incoming pallets, immediate removal of broken or dirty pallets

requirements.text: Is the area around the dumpster/cull truck/trash area clean?
mandatoryStatements: Areas around dumpsters and waste disposal must be maintained clean
Spills and debris must be cleaned up regularly
Waste areas must not provide pest attractants
Regular cleaning schedule for waste areas required
Pest control measures must be enhanced in waste areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly dumpster area cleanliness inspection, monthly comprehensive waste area sanitation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily visual check of dumpster area cleanliness, immediate cleanup of spills or debris

requirements.text: Are outside garbage receptacles and dumpsters kept covered or closed?
mandatoryStatements: Outside garbage receptacles and dumpsters must be kept covered or closed
Lids must be functional and used consistently
Covers prevent pest access and weather exposure
Regular inspection must verify proper closure
Damaged lids must be repaired or replaced
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly verification of dumpster lid functionality and use, monthly waste container condition assessment
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that dumpsters are closed after use, immediate repair of damaged lids

requirements.text: Are all water lines protected against back siphonage?
mandatoryStatements: Water lines must be protected against back siphonage with backflow prevention devices
Backflow prevention assemblies must be installed on water supply lines
Annual testing and certification of backflow devices required
Test records must be maintained
Non-potable water lines must be clearly identified and separated
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual backflow prevention device testing and certification, maintenance of current certificates
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate repair or replacement of failed backflow devices, verification of annual testing compliance

requirements.text: Where there is an on-site laboratory, is it completely enclosed and separated from production and storage areas?
mandatoryStatements: On-site laboratories must be completely enclosed and separated from production areas
Physical barriers must prevent contamination transfer
Laboratory access must be controlled and restricted
Air pressure differentials should prevent air flow from lab to production
Laboratory procedures must prevent cross-contamination to products
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual laboratory separation and contamination control assessment, quarterly verification of physical barriers
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly verification of laboratory separation integrity, immediate correction of barrier breaches

capaInject: Implement shatter-resistant light protection program with inspection schedules, documentation of protective measures (sleeves, coatings, shields), and replacement protocols for damaged protections.
Establish ventilation system maintenance program with filter replacement schedules, airflow direction verification, condensation management procedures, and microbial monitoring for high-risk areas.
Create drain maintenance program with cleaning schedules, trap inspection protocols, backflow prevention verification, and slope assessments to ensure proper drainage.
Develop wall, ceiling, and floor integrity inspection program with documentation of cracks, holes, or damage findings and prioritized repair schedules based on contamination risk.
Implement door and window maintenance program with pest exclusion inspections, seal integrity verification, automatic door function testing, and screen condition assessments.
traceabilityInject: Maintain light fixture inspection logs showing dates, locations, protective measure status, findings of broken or missing protection, corrective actions, and verification of repairs.
Document ventilation system maintenance records including filter replacement dates, airflow measurements, condensation observations, cleaning activities, and microbial test results for air quality.
Keep drain system inspection and maintenance logs showing cleaning dates, trap inspections, findings of blockages or backflow, repairs performed, and verification of proper function.
Maintain building integrity inspection records documenting dates, areas inspected, findings of structural damage, pest entry points identified, repair work orders, and completion verification.
Keep pest exclusion maintenance logs for doors and windows showing inspection dates, findings of gaps or damage, seal replacements, screen repairs, and verification of pest exclusion effectiveness.
micro_inject: Broken lights can shatter and contaminate products with glass fragments; lack of protective measures creates unacceptable physical hazard risks and potential for product recalls.
Poor ventilation creates condensation that promotes Listeria growth on ceilings and walls; condensate dripping onto product or food contact surfaces directly introduces environmental pathogens.
Drains with standing water or backflow issues become Listeria reservoirs; aerosols from drain systems spread pathogens throughout production areas via air currents and splash.
Cracks in walls, ceilings, and floors provide harborage for pests and protect bacteria from cleaning chemicals; these niches allow pathogen populations to persist and recontaminate cleaned areas.
Gaps around doors and windows allow pest entry including flies, rodents, and birds that introduce pathogens; inadequate pest exclusion compromises all other sanitation efforts.
